required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neurocognitive and Neurobiological Improvement in ADHD Children by Modification of Dietary Protein
clinical_study.official_title: Neurocognitive and Neurobiological Improvement in ADHD Children by Modification of Dietary Protein

brief_summary.textblock: Multicenter, Prospective, randomized, comparative and controlled study about the beneficial effects in behavior and brain connectivity of different dietary patterns in 100 children with ADHD between 7 and 12 years, followed up for 3 months of nutritional therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators collect electroencephalogram (EEG), event related potentials (ERP) data, and behavior parameters in ADD/ADHD children that not take stimulants or other drugs during study. They would only follow some nutritional recommendations based on increasing the amount of dietary protein and fast carbohydrates decrease. The duration of the study will be 6 months, 3 months for recruitment and 3 months for dietary treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Reaction time during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.
Omission errors during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach. (Test duration: 22 minutes)
comission errors during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.(Test duration: 22 minutes)

primary_outcome.measure: Occipital Alpha Brainwaves Amplitudes at 3 Months
primary_outcome.description: occipital alpha waves amplitudes during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.
Mu waves-amplitude during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.

primary_outcome.measure: Frontal Midline Theta Activity- Amplitude at 3 Months
primary_outcome.description: Frontal midline theta activity- amplitude during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.

secondary_outcome.description: occipital alpha waves-frequency during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.
Parietal alpha waves-frequency during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.
Mu wave frequency during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frontal Midline Theta Activity- Frequency at 3 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Frontal midline theta activity- frequency during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.
Monastra ratio during visual continuous performance task from 19 channels EEG recordings, after 3 months of dietary approach.

Behavior assessed by total score of clinical questionnaire (sum of Hyperactivity, Impulsivity and Inattention scores), after 3 months of nutritional approach. Range: minimum value: 0 and maximum value: 25. Higher values represent a worse outcome.
Hyperactivity assessed by clinical questionnaire after 3 months of nutritional approach. Range: minimum value: 0 and maximum value: 8. Higher values represent a worse outcome.
Impulsivity assessed by clinical questionnaire after 3 months of nutritional approach. Range: minimum value: 0 and maximum value: 8. Higher values represent a worse outcome.
Inattention assessed by clinical questionnaire after 3 months of nutritional approach. Range: minimum value: 0 and maximum value: 9. Higher values represent a worse outcome.

other_outcome.description: Weight after 3 months of dietary approach.
Body mass index after 3 months of dietary approach.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
other_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability of Brain Proteins Supplements

arm_group.description: This group of patients receive 2.000 kilocalories diet(60 g. carbohydrates, 144 gr of fat and 107 gr of proteins), including 2 protein shakes.
the second group of patients receive diet of 2.000 Kilo calories without rapidly absorbed carbohydrates and without proteins supplements

intervention.description: This group of patients receive 2.000 kilo-calories diet (60 g. carbohydrates, 144 gr of fat and 107 gr of proteins), including 2 protein shakes.
the second group of patients receive diet of 2.000 Kilo-calories without rapidly absorbed carbohydrates and without proteins supplements

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ADHD diagnosed 12 months before
- no take medication
- BMI above the 25th percentile
- Wiesel score between 80 and 100 (about 120)
- Patients who agree to participate and whose guardians signed the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- eating disorders
- psychosis, bipolar disorder or depression
- kidney or liver failure
- diabetes
- diuretic or cortisone treatment
- haematological problems
- suprarenal diseases
- cancer
- Brain injury
- Cardiovascular or arrhythmia problems

group.description: This group of patients receive diet of 2.000 Kilo-calories without rapidly absorbed carbohydrates and without proteins supplements

measure.description: Behavior assessed by total score of clinical questionnaire (sum of Hyperactivity, Impulsivity and Inattention scores). Range: minimum value: 0 and maximum value: 25. Higher values represent a worse outcome.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
